data.text: @unique_anonym @data_lore @JT_Grindrod Oh i meant, we should be able to plan strategies around that data now because it has been around for so long
@DonEford @data_lore @JT_Grindrod and that fact has not changed.
@unique_anonym @data_lore @JT_Grindrod Yeah, and that's super old by covid standards
@DonEford @data_lore @JT_Grindrod The Lancet study in pic was a revelation. https://t.co/EHq5avNrzC
@BiasSelf @data_lore @NoyesJHumphrey It would probably be bad to stretch a rubber glove over your head and use that as a mask.. I would assume ..

@BiasSelf @data_lore @NoyesJHumphrey Masks are like gloves? So an n95 mask letâ€™s 5% of particles and viruses through.. if gloves were like masks then I would be worried that gloves would let through 5% of the hydrofluoric acid ur working with..

@data_lore @JT_Grindrod A concussion twice within a year will result in permanent brain damage.
I read that a couple of years ago via PubMed article.
@data_lore For only six to nine months or for at least six to nine months? That's an important distinction.
@ChristosArgyrop @ZiikZiiii @data_lore Explains @BallouxFrancois inability to remember how many infections he has had while minimising the damage caused by covid. 🤡

@JeffCavanagh1 @data_lore Yeah this study kinda fails with the short term prediction.  With most people, if they hit 6 months the chance of returning to normal appears to be small.  At least in the near term (years)
